scenario: Sam uses spreadsheets and BI tools but needs Python and R to automate reporting and run experiments while balancing a full-time job and evening study.
expectations: Clear progression from fundamentals to applied analytics
Practical guidance on tooling and environments (Anaconda, RStudio, Jupyter)

phases.title: Awareness
actions: Searches 'learn Python for marketing analytics' and 'R A/B testing course'
Reads NC State course page and skim-screens sample syllabus
Checks LinkedIn job postings for Python/R requirements
pains: Overwhelmed by the number of options and mixed prerequisites
Unsure whether Python or R is better for marketing use cases
Concerned about time commitment alongside work

feelings.quote: I need the right pathâ€”no fluff, just what gets me productive fast.

opportunities: Provide a comparison table: Python vs R for common analytics tasks
Show a week-by-week outline with estimated time per week
Include graduate outcomes and sample project demos

phases.title: Consideration
actions: Attends a live info session and asks about workload
Reads learner testimonials focused on career impact
pains: Unsure if prior statistics knowledge is sufficient
Anxious about juggling deadlines with campaigns at work

feelings.quote: If setup and stats refresh are covered, I can commit.

opportunities: Offer a pre-course setup clinic and stats refresher module
Publish a sample assignment with rubric and time estimate
Highlight support options (office hours, Slack/Discord, tutoring)

phases.title: Enrollment
actions: Registers online and selects a payment plan
Downloads onboarding guide and installs Anaconda and RStudio
pains: Confusion about which IDE to start with for the first module
Anxious about package installation and version conflicts
Time pressure to finish onboarding before kickoff

feelings.quote: Please let this install work the first time.

opportunities: Provide step-by-step OS-specific installers and a verified environment file
Offer a 1:1 tech check slot prior to week one

phases.title: Engagement
actions: Builds a capstone: automated campaign performance report
Posts questions and code snippets in discussion channels
pains: Debugging data wrangling errors under time pressure
Connecting course concepts to marketing KPIs

feelings.quote: I can see this saving hours at work if I nail it.

opportunities: Provide starter notebooks and example plots with copy/paste patterns
Map each module to real marketing metrics and use cases
Structured peer code reviews with checklists
